revised_title: Correction of Solar Tables Based on Mr. South's Observations
tldr: The author, G. B. Airy, investigates discrepancies between the sun's observed and calculated positions and proposes corrections to the solar tables. He finds that the epoch of the sun's longitude should be increased by 8.97", the mean anomaly should be decreased by 99.8", and the greatest equation of the center should be decreased by 1.09".
